8.heading: Torch Bearers.
8.title: "Rabindranath Tagore : India's Gentle Torch-Bearer"
8.author: script, Kayanaksha Banerjee ; illustrations, Souren Roy ; cover, C
8.appears_in: M. Vitankar ; editor, Anant Pai. 31 p. in Amar Chitra Katha ; no. 548 (1977, 2005 printing).
notes: (Visionaries)
Biographical.

Summary from back cover: "He rejected formal education and yet began a world-famous university. His poems were mocked for the colloquial language but they were adopted as anthems by two countries. Bengali society despaired of him until he was awarded the coveted Nobel Prize for Literature and a knighthood! Rabindranath Tagore, whose multi-faceted life was as fascinating as it is inspiring, lives on in his books, his music and his thought-provoking, unconventional ideals."
Tagore lived 1861-1941.
Subtitle, series and summary from 2010 printing.

9.title: "The Torch Goes Wild"
9.author: [No author]
9.series: Fantastic Four) 20 p. in Fantastic Four, no. 99

10.title: "The Torch Goes Wild!"
10.author: script and plot, Stan Lee ; art and plot, Dick Ayers
10.appears_in: 13 p. in Marvel Tales, no. 21 (July 1969) ; reprinted from Strange Tales, no. 119 (Apr. 1964).
notes: Summary: A demagogue called the Rabble Rouser (Vitold Niyazov) drums up public opinion against the Torch, as part of a communist plot against an American ally. The Torch regains the public trust by stopping him and using his own mind control devices to turn him to the American side.
Data from Bob Klein, Lou Mougin, Martin O'Hearn, et al. via Grand Comics Database.

13.title: "The Torch Meets Iceman!"
13.author: script and plot, Stan Lee ; pencils and plot, Jack Kirby ; inks, Dick Ayers
13.appears_in: 14 p. in Strange Tales, no. 120 (May 1964) ; reprinted in Marvel Tales, no. 22 (Sept. 1969).
notes: Summary: Johnny's riled because a newspaper compares Iceman (Bobby Drake of the X-Men) to him. On a cruise liner, Bobby tries to pick up Doris Evans, until Johnny arrives. Before the rivalry goes too far, The Barracuda (a modern-day pirate) and his men arrive and take over the ship. Johnny & Bobby team up to stop them.
X-Men cameo.
Data from Bob Klein, Lou Mougin, Martin O'Hearn, et al. via Grand Comics Database.

89.heading: Torelli, Luca.
89.title: "Belle"
89.author: E
89.appears_in: Sánchez Abulí, Alex Toth. 8 p. in Torpedo 1936 (New York : Catalan Communications, 1984).
notes: First story.
Summary: Luca Torelli, "The Torpedo," takes a contract to kill Belle. She's so attractive that he fakes her death and moves in with her, until she leaves him. Luca then pays Rascal to kill Belle.

90.heading: Torelli, Luca.
90.title: "Cold as a Fish"
90.author: E
90.appears_in: Sánchez Abulí, Jordi Bernet. 10 p. in Torpedo 1936 (New York : Catalan Communications, 1984).
notes: Summary: A fish seller named Adriano is being threatened by rival sellers named Larson. Luciana the beautiful wife comes to Luca Torelli for help in getting the Larsons to leave them alone. She offers her savings, but Luca would rather take it out in trade. Luca takes a kiss for a down payment, then roughs up the Larsons. When he tries to collect his fee, Luciana refuses and he knocks her down. Adriano comes to thank Luca and to show Luca to his son as a role model.

91.heading: Torelli, Luca.
91.title: "Dumbo"
91.author: E
91.appears_in: Sánchez Abulí, Jordi Bernet. 8 p. in Torpedo 1936 (New York : Catalan Communications, 1984).
notes: Summary: A hitman with big ears, called "Dumbo," is after Luca Torelli, and puts a bullet in Luca's shoulder. While he's getting patched up, Luca has the doctor give him a cast with an artificial hand sticking out of it. In a setup at a barber shop, Luca finds out who sent Dumbo, and kills them both.

92.heading: Torelli, Luca.
92.title: "Every Dog Has His Day"
92.author: E
92.appears_in: Sánchez Abulí, Jordi Bernet. 8 p. in Torpedo 1936 (New York : Catalan Communications, 1984).
notes: Summary: Hired to kill Frank Forever, who is a very cautious man, Luca Torelli subcontracts with Susie, a prostitute, to help set it up. The hit goes as planned, but Luca's plan to retrieve the money he gave Susie doesn't work because she brought her pimp in the back seat. The pimp, named Reno, scars Luca's face and he and Susie leave with the money and the car. Luca plots revenge.

93.heading: Torelli, Luca.
93.title: "Flash-Back"
93.author: E
93.appears_in: Sánchez Abulí, Jordi Bernet. 10 p. in Torpedo 1936 2 (New York : Catalan Communications, 1985).
notes: Summary: A young Luca Torelli begs to join a robbery, so they let him drive the getaway car. He doesn't know how to drive, and he wrecks the car, but they get away. When they try to give him five percent instead of twenty-five, he kills two of the gang. The fourth member of the gang is Nelly, a woman so attractive that she scares him even without a gun.

94.heading: Torelli, Luca.
94.title: "Judas Job"
94.author: E
94.appears_in: Sánchez Abulí, Alex Toth. 8 p. in Torpedo 1936 (New York : Catalan Communications, 1984).
notes: Summary: Luca Torelli takes the job of killing his boyhood friend Pietro Mottolo. Pietro's seven-year-old son Benno swears he'll kill Luca when he grows up.

95.heading: Torelli, Luca.
95.title: "Once Upon America"
95.author: E
95.appears_in: Sanchez Abuli, Jordi Bernet. 10 p. in Torpedo 1936 5 (New York : Catalan Communications, 1988).
notes: Summary: Back in Italy, we see Luca Torelli as a young boy. Luca's drunken father beats his mother, and kills Luca's older brother in a rage. Luca arranges for his father to get killed, and his mother dies grieving for him. Luca never figures her out.

96.heading: Torelli, Luca.
96.title: "Shoot Back in Anger"
96.author: E
96.appears_in: Sanchez Abuli, Jordi Bernet. 8 p. in Torpedo 1936 7 (New York : Catalan Communications, 1991).
notes: Summary: The story of Luca Torelli's mother, whose two sons were conceived through rapes by her father and the godfather of her older son Mario. Luca is named after the godfather's dog.

97.heading: Torelli, Luca.
97.title: "The Tip-Off"
97.author: E
97.appears_in: Sánchez Abulí, Jordi Bernet. 8 p. in Torpedo 1936 (New York : Catalan Communications, 1984).
notes: Summary: Luca Torelli is sent to Paris for a revenge killing: Jones was a bank robber who turned in his pals and ran with the money. The employer sends his trusted friend McGee along to help. McGee turns out to be a friend of Jones, so Luca has to kill both of them.

98.heading: Torelli, Mario.
98.title: "Shoot Back in Anger"
98.author: E
98.appears_in: Sanchez Abuli, Jordi Bernet. 8 p. in Torpedo 1936 7 (New York : Catalan Communications, 1991).
notes: Summary: The story of Luca Torelli's mother, whose two sons were conceived through rapes by her father and the godfather of her older son Mario. Luca is named after the godfather's dog.

125.heading: Torii, Daisuke.
125.title: Zombie Fairy
125.author: Daisuke Torii.
notes: "A boy named Aoto brings a family heirloom. a coffin, to a TV show to determine its worth. Suddenly, a 600-year-old Chinese girl named Chun-Ai pops out of the coffin. In a trance, she trashes the studio. After she she passes out, Aoto decides he has no choice but to bring her home, where his quirky family agrees to take her in. But they soon find themselves in over their heads! Chun-ai is joined by a friend from the past, and they are all attacked by a giant, vengeful tiger spirit.

Vampire fiction.
